result.execSummary:
The defendant Nichole M. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Racine County case 15CF785 and concurrent with Monroe County case 15CF89

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $2,020.09 plus restitution surcharge of $202.01 for a total of $2,222.10.

No contact with All American Do It Center.

No contact with Casey's General Store.

No contact with any Kwik Trip.

No possession of any negotiable instruments or checks.

Comply with any conditions and no contacts per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
